column1: With Thanksgiving here and the holidays around the corner all while the COVID-19 pandemic surges in Illinois I am asking you to support our local food banks and feed families in need. https://t.co/YDB0KOYxae
We have reached another grim milestone in the COVID-19 pandemic: more than 250000 Americans have died. Please continue to keep yourself your family and your community safe. https://t.co/ike1V4JwF3

It is President Trump’s responsibility to work with President-elect @JoeBiden on vaccine distribution to ensure that Americans receive the COVID-19 vaccine as soon as possible. https://t.co/KY9ikzn4Ul

As COVID-19 continues to surge in Illinois please take steps to keep yourself your family and your community safe by staying home when you can and wearing a mask when you can’t. https://t.co/BbCQYzjfSO

COVID-19 is causing a crisis for the doctors nurses and health care workers on the frontlines. We need to support our health care heroes—and pass a bipartisan pandemic relief bill ASAP. https://t.co/oMDmMqV38e
We have our work cut out for us. Looking forward to working with our next POTUS @JoeBiden and VP @KamalaHarris to address the important issues—from COVID-19 to climate change. https://t.co/hhhwLTlFy1
As the holidays approach precautions to stop the spread of COVID-19 in Illinois are essential. https://t.co/h1jooYQOHv

As COVID-19 cases surge in Illinois we all need to do our part to keep our communities safe. Stay home as much as you can—and when you can’t wear a mask and keep social distance. https://t.co/MMsyHhFHoK

COVID-19 cases are surging in Illinois. This pandemic is not over. Please continue to stay safe social distance wash your hands and wear a mask. We must stop the spread of this virus. https://t.co/a0U7ZfhGNb

Great to join the @PoliticsKBUR podcast to discuss COVID-19 relief fixing our economy our fight to defend this Democratic seat here in Illinois and much more. Listen to our conversation: https://t.co/pdaHaAOHyv
Even with two of my Republican colleagues on the Judiciary Committee diagnosed with COVID-19 Mitch McConnell is still moving forward with confirming Amy Coney Barrett. https://t.co/IGOx9NVI59
I was sorry to learn that Dr. Wilson has tested positive for COVID-19. I wish him and his staff a speedy recovery.
It’s up to all of us to continue taking the coronavirus seriously. Please practice social distancing wear a mask and wash your hands. These small actions can save lives.

When COVID-19 hit I made it a priority to secure emergency loans to help small businesses weather the storm. Proud to highlight the story of one local business in my new TV ad. https://t.co/cUtoIG8ezj

Tonight @KamalaHarris will discuss how @JoeBiden is the leader the country needs and the Biden-Harris vision to contain COVID-19 and build America back better. I am all in for @JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris and I can’t wait to see her on the debate stage.

Wishing the President and First Lady a speedy recovery.   Illinoisans please continue to wear masks keep social distance and follow public health guidelines during this pandemic. https://t.co/rxk9j4wBI1
We need the funding to expand the rapid COVID-19 testing pioneered by @Illinois_Alma. https://t.co/poHOGkCu2c

We can’t turn our backs on farmers in Illinois and across the country. They deserve leaders who listen to their needs and concerns—from COVID-19 relief to strengthening our trade markets. https://t.co/46DTkHCiqv

As the #COVID19 crisis continues to impact our economy we must do more to support struggling student loan borrowers. @TammyforIL @chuckschumer @ewarren and I introduced a plan for the President to cancel up to $50000 in student loan debt for federal borrowers.

We need to leave the COVID-19 vaccine developments to the scientists. Politicians—including President Trump—should not be trying to influence or politicize this process for their own gain. https://t.co/XFBCcbDew7

It is troubling that HHS commandeered COVID-19 testing supplies that were meant for colleges in Illinois. This lack of planning is interfering with schools’ ability to keep their campuses safe. https://t.co/LdpMuPrIkb

There’s no way around it: President Trump’s calculated decision to mislead the American public about the dangers of COVID-19 has contributed to the tragic loss of more than 190000 lives. https://t.co/YipPe7zQrx

Americans are rightfully skeptical about President Trump’s politically-convenient rapid timeline for a COVID-19 vaccine. We need a safe and effective vaccine based on science not politics. https://t.co/CRL3WhfPDE
Enough showboating from Mitch McConnell. Senate Republicans need to come back to the negotiating table and debate the COVID-19 relief package that already passed the House.  https://t.co/LEAPiRdWd9
Mitch McConnell has stood by and done nothing to help families and communities through the #COVID19 crisis. Americans deserve better than a Republican Senate that refuses to act.

I’m urging the Dept. of Defense to adopt @Illinois_Alma’s state-of-the-art #COVID19 testing system. These tests are not only fast and effective but more affordable than other options. https://t.co/oGmtLfh8tB

Our nation is facing multiple crises at this critical juncture from the coronavirus pandemic to the scourge of systemic racism and injustice. And time and again President Trump and Mitch McConnell are proving that they simply aren't up to the task of solving these big problems.

The American people need assurance that any vaccine for COVID-19 will be safe and effective. I’m calling on the Trump Admin to maintain the integrity of any vaccine candidate’s safety and efficacy and not cut corners. https://t.co/fk7MKd3Yyz

As part of Congress’ response to the #COVID19 pandemic we must do everything we can to ensure individuals and families can access health insurance and enhanced unemployment benefits. https://t.co/ERS3o89lJ1
Great to join @21stShow to discuss USPS COVID-19 relief our Democratic ticket and more. https://t.co/w5mTdD3oDI
If the Dept. of Defense can’t protect detainees and personnel at Guantanamo Bay from contracting COVID-19 during this pandemic all the more reason the prison should be closed. https://t.co/6l0zetlVsa

We can’t allow the COVID-19 pandemic to interrupt or halt vital medical research projects. I am calling on the Senate to appropriate additional funding for the National Institutes of Health. https://t.co/Jo1kMXlytt

Colleges and universities across the nation can look to the University of Illinois for an example of the revolutionary contact tracing and COVID-19 testing plans we need on campuses this fall. https://t.co/dGbYeoW85L

The economic impacts of the COVID-19 crisis can’t be solved with the President signing executive orders from the golf course. It’s past time for Senate Republicans to do their job. https://t.co/OMBk6wH38I

Our bipartisan Force to Fight COVID-19 proposal is a comprehensive plan to provide a “shot in the arm” to our struggling hospitals and public health agencies during this public health crisis. https://t.co/zBpksjDqTq

Local governments are on the frontlines of the COVID-19 crisis. I spoke with local mayors from across Illinois about the need to support our local communities by passing the Heroes Act. https://t.co/maWwLqkur7

I spoke to @WGNRadio about a range of issues including my memories of the late Rep. John Lewis the next COVID-19 relief bill and safely getting our students back to school this fall. https://t.co/RImvzp2lUD

It’s time for the Senate to pass the Coronavirus Child Care and Education Relief Act to provide the crucial investment that our school districts need here in Illinois and all across the nation. https://t.co/bSyn4cvOTx

Investing in child care and education is even more important in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. I’m working to ensure Senate Democrats’ plan is included in the next federal relief package. https://t.co/VWXf8EIcZQ

President Trump’s attacks on Dr. Fauci are unacceptable. I stand with Dr. Fauci and all of the public health experts doctors and scientists in this fight against coronavirus. Are you with me? https://t.co/iHcWil2eA3
It’s past time for Mitch McConnell and the Senate GOP to get serious. We need a strong bipartisan COVID-19 response—not closed door meetings about a partisan Republican bill. https://t.co/Lws800ZGpg

Critical COVID-19 relief measures that Congress passed this spring are set to expire soon. We can’t leave families in limbo waiting to know whether they’ll get the help they urgently need. https://t.co/DkTQvev61m
I spoke with leaders in Peoria this past week to discuss the pressing issues the community has been facing because of #COVID19.  https://t.co/nMf8uxH41q

More than 5 million people have lost their health insurance due to COVID-19. Congress should let people keep their employer health care plans at no cost so they can get through the pandemic. https://t.co/7tUWdIBHUg
We must work together to fight COVID-19. Be smart and wear a mask. 😷
COVID-19 has caused record breaking unemployment leaving millions of Americans without healthcare. I will not stop fighting until Congress passes the HEROES Act. https://t.co/9DM7QZ3tOu

Good news: thanks to our advocacy the Trump Administration has backtracked and rescinded its threat to deport international students. This is an important move to make sure our young people can continue their educations while staying safe from COVID-19.

I was in East St. Louis this week talking about the urgent need for police reform to combat the disproportionately high rates of COVID-19 in the African American and Hispanic communities and to extend expanded unemployment benefits. https://t.co/x4i26x2Uds
It’s clear that Mitch McConnell and the GOP are only focused on confirming right-wing judges—not helping the American people weather the storm posed by the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/nJYUje9xIR

Last week I asked Dr. Francis Collins director of the National Institutes of Health about the progress being made on a COVID-19 vaccine. We must ensure this vaccine is safe and effective. https://t.co/86D6QuxhOm
As we respond to the COVID-19 crisis we must prioritize ensuring affordable broadband. Closing the digital divide is more urgent than ever as we navigate this new reality. https://t.co/PRBl3TDtrZ

Supporting our hospitals is more important than ever. That’s why I am calling on HHS Sec. Azar to address COVID-19 relief funding shortfalls at safety net hospitals including children’s hospitals in Illinois. https://t.co/o6YjrTQ68P

The House passed the #HeroesAct more than a month ago—but we are still waiting for GOP Leader Mitch McConnell to feel the “sense of urgency” to respond to the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/jcJUTUNb2n

We should be doing everything we can to make it easier for every Illinois voter to cast their ballot. I commend @JBPritzker and IL state legislators for expanding vote-by-mail in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/7mp4voHZUI

I am encouraging community colleges in Illinois to offer training courses to help address the need for contact tracers to help our state and our country respond to the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/gqQNqQjeoz

The Bureau of Prisons has not only the authority but the duty to take the necessary steps to protect sick and vulnerable inmates from the spread of COVID-19 in our federal prison system. https://t.co/yRaIzPIyfP

The #COVID19 pandemic is not over. We must remain vigilant listen to our public health experts practice social distancing and wear masks in public to save lives in our communities. https://t.co/hhbRfz2CEe
As the economy starts to reopen in Illinois I am encouraged by the decrease in cases of COVID-19 in our state. But this pandemic isn’t over—we must keep working to save lives. https://t.co/9imNHvJtLF

Testing is crucial to getting through the #COVID19 crisis. I am proud to report that testing is now available to everyone Illinois—and we have surpassed 1 million tests conducted statewide. https://t.co/vuK5EbkMkW

This decision by President Trump is just reckless. The nation with the most #COVID19 infections and deaths should not be turning its back on the global efforts to curb this pandemic. https://t.co/uajZToAtT7

Glad that these crucial funds will be used to expand #COVID19 testing all across Illinois. We cannot safely reopen our economy until everyone in our state has access to testing. https://t.co/jI31nH0ojh

More than 100000 Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19 during this pandemic. We will never forget those we have lost. May their memories be a blessing to their loved ones. https://t.co/7IBhEKS0DI

Thank you to the health care professionals at COVID-19 testing sites like the one at UI Health's Mile Square Health Center-South Shore for all you are doing to protect our public health. https://t.co/1qqJKzbhbD

I am encouraged that the Federal Bureau of Prisons is listening to our concerns and ensuring all inmates are tested for COVID-19 before transferring them to a quarantine site and removing Thomson as a quarantine site. https://t.co/bxlvyccdAx

Mitch McConnell and the GOP think there is no sense of urgency for us to take further action to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic. Struggling families across the country beg to differ. https://t.co/jmjJa6uGh0

Mitch McConnell and the GOP have made it clear that they have no “sense of urgency” when it comes to passing additional #COVID19 relief. Democrats are ready to get to work for the people. https://t.co/qoKOxFOoW9
The #COVID19 crisis only heightens the need for workplace protections for our mine workers. https://t.co/btt8djPvAC

We are facing historic levels of unemployment with nearly 40 million claims in the last two months—and Mitch McConnell refuses to take up further #COVID19 relief bills. Inexcusable. https://t.co/z9qoQV4DeW

The warnings from our public health experts are clear. If we fail to reopen in a safe responsible way we risk uncontrollable #COVID19 outbreaks with more deaths and economic damage. https://t.co/K3a2VUAsQO

Not only is deporting individuals with COVID-19 inhumane—it undermines our own efforts to contain this virus and protect our public health. President Trump should reverse course. https://t.co/ZxVfkKxJOV

As we witness racial disparities exacerbated and laid bare by COVID-19 I commend @JoeBiden for releasing his Plan for Black America. We need him and his agenda in the White House now more than ever. #LiftEveryVoice https://t.co/lYjr0w9UAE

I am joining @Brady_PAC to remind everyone in Illinois and across the nation how important it is to safely store firearms especially during this #COVID19 pandemic. #SafeStorageSavesLives https://t.co/RjjIumTwfD
The Senate should adopt our bipartisan plan to allow remote voting during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/Tv473yisQY

We must support our state and local governments who have taken huge hits due to the #COVID19 crisis. I will keep pushing the Trump Administration to assist states like Illinois. https://t.co/bqaiemL1A0

This Giving Tuesday I am asking you to support the Illinois COVID-19 Response Fund which is helping non-profit groups serve the communities hardest hit by this crisis. #GivingTuesdayNow https://t.co/Mfipq18NfE

We must be humane while protecting public health. We’re calling on the Trump Administration to ensure all migrants are tested for #COVID19 before they are transferred or deported. https://t.co/KlZOKOQfkE

In emergencies like the #COVID19 crisis the Senate should update its traditions to allow for remote voting. We should not have to choose between public safety and our constitutional duty. https://t.co/fG3vjTY63Q
We should not be transferring prisoners who have not been properly tested for #COVID19. https://t.co/lZruJTS2iL

Requiring meat and poultry plants to stay open during this pandemic is an irresponsible decision without a serious plan in place for increased #COVID19 testing and strong worker protections. https://t.co/rUgRuP3xp4
Please continue to stay safe and #StayHome. We must do everything we can to slow the spread of #COVID19 so that we can begin to return to work & school and reopen our economy. https://t.co/4Hpe5Pzb1y
We are all deeply saddened by the news of 144 more Illinoisans who have lost their lives to #COVID19. We must increase testing and continue social distancing to save lives. https://t.co/xHmMDDNsKX
The Federal Bureau of Prisons should not be transferring inmates from Chicago to other facilities in Illinois without first properly testing for #COVID19. https://t.co/dSxPBw3hWD

Democrats have already laid out a national #COVID19 testing strategy which is extremely important if we want to start getting back to work and getting our country back on track. https://t.co/0djdLqWf6C

Together with @ewarren I’m fighting to ensure that any future #COVID19 stimulus packages in the Senate support our public and non-profit schools — not predatory for-profit colleges. https://t.co/TxBEWSt76R

Social distancing is not possible in prisons. The people living and working in these confined spaces are vulnerable during the #COVID19 crisis — and we need action to protect them. https://t.co/VyElMVO5tT
We need to support our broadcasters and local newspapers during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/Bvb8RPfCPG

Our federal prisons should be quickly transferring vulnerable inmates to home confinement and expanding coronavirus testing within the prison system to help slow the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/R1TpVX3pg8

Our state and local governments are taking on enormous costs during this pandemic. We must ensure that the next #COVID19 relief bill includes support for our cities counties and states. https://t.co/UmlM0jvudU
Joined @TammyforIL to introduce the #COVID19 Every Worker Protection Act because all of our essential workers deserve safe healthy working conditions during this crisis. https://t.co/He34FMaA2R

We need to ramp up #COVID19 testing in a serious way. We cannot safely bring an end to the current stay-at-home orders in Illinois and states across the country without testing everywhere. https://t.co/rnEGTeWMfu

Proud to join @KamalaHarris in calling for coronavirus stimulus checks to be exempted from seizure by debt collectors. This money is meant to support struggling families — period. https://t.co/bqa2DwiRyU

Illinois farmers were already facing challenges before the #COVID19 pandemic. We need to support our agriculture industry as they weather the economic storm posed by this health crisis. https://t.co/gAzVQ3dT1n
Thank you to everyone who is helping to stop the spread of #COVID19 by staying home. https://t.co/Y5UNqig8RE

I am pleased that the Federal Bureau of Prisons answered our call to make phone calls and video visits free for inmates after the suspension of in-person visitation due to coronavirus. https://t.co/xOUOXeFZH0

We need a national strategy for COVID-19 testing. That’s why this week Senate Democrats rolled out our comprehensive plan to ensure testing is available for everyone across the nation. https://t.co/5mkXeaAVGN

Sadly domestic violence is soaring as people across the country stay home. I’m joining the bipartisan call for future #COVID19 legislation to ensure survivors have the support they need. https://t.co/rlKqqkmH4T

The racial disparities that have been magnified during this pandemic are unacceptable. We need action to address the disproportionate impacts of #COVID19 in communities of color. https://t.co/5vPdd3AZRv

We are making progress in the fight against #COVID19 in Illinois but we must continue to stay the course. Stay home practice social distancing and help keep yourself and others safe. https://t.co/v9jmF7jvkw

The Illinois COVID-19 Response Fund is mobilizing to help the most vulnerable people in our state as we face down this crisis together. Consider making a donation to show your support. https://t.co/FgXLGZXJsR

As hospitals in Illinois face this unprecedented public health crisis it’s important that we provide them with the resources they need to continue treating patients with #COVID19. https://t.co/njtZdB20WR

This is excellent news. The @shedd_aquarium has loaned state-of-the-art equipment to the Illinois Department of Public Health to help test for and identify coronavirus in human patients. https://t.co/YPlWW3K1ZF
This funding is critically necessary for our local and state public health departments as they continue to respond to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/VGelKUBJvY

I spoke with @mitchellreports about why the Senate’s coronavirus response must be bipartisan and about the urgent action we need to take to address the racial disparities in health care. https://t.co/Dg924spqjy
We cannot allow predatory for-profit schools to take advantage of the important funding we’ve designated for higher education as we respond to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/rEAfTx5zCA
We are calling on student loan companies to provide much-needed relief to student borrowers during the #COVID19 public health emergency. https://t.co/Fz7wou8tly

Sign the petition now to join the call for personal protective equipment for our health care heroes the front lines of this pandemic — then make a donation to support #COVID19 relief in Illinois. https://t.co/bORJhHlHvX
We need to be doing everything we can to support our farmers during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/FnZRXx12fT

I’m glad that the Department of the Treasury heeded our call and will no longer require Social Security recipients to file a tax return in order to receive their coronavirus stimulus check. https://t.co/AXZzxAXDoB

It is essential that we keep our public transportation systems operational during this crisis. Our COVID-19 relief bill provides crucial support for Illinois’ airports railroads and mass transit. https://t.co/oe0dmOuofA
Experts have been warning for weeks about the spread of #COVID19 in our federal prisons. We need urgent action including the release of vulnerable inmates. https://t.co/sk16AJBH3a
Our goal must be to save as many lives as possible during this pandemic. Please continue to stay home and help stop the spread of #COVID19 in Illinois. https://t.co/mxT9NzxMwN

With COVID-19 cases continuing to rise in Illinois and across the nation it’s important that we continue to stay home and practice social distancing to help stop the spread of coronavirus. https://t.co/IqwmsBLbl3

The bipartisan coronavirus relief package that passed in the Senate includes approx $4.9 billion in direct assistance to Illinois’ state and local governments to help keep Illinoisans safe. https://t.co/BGvxwQLt3e

I joined Gov. @JBPritzker for an important update on what we’re doing to fight coronavirus in Illinois. We are pleased that President Trump approved our request for a major disaster declaration to help our state recover from this crisis. https://t.co/orrTH8Shau

The Trump Administration should use its authority under the First Step Act to release the most vulnerable inmates or transfer them to home confinement to help stop the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/X47BvFDm03

Gov. @JBPritzker has extended Illinois’ state tax deadline to July 15 due to the COVID-19 crisis. This is a welcome move that will help families and businesses through this tough time. https://t.co/5b6QJQLqpH

I am urging FDA Commissioner Stephen Hahn to increase coronavirus test kit materials and medical equipment for the health care workers who are fighting this pandemic in Illinois. https://t.co/ybzutQBsKi

I am supporting food banks and organizations across our state and region that are mobilizing to respond to the COVID-19 crisis and help feed and support families in need. Will you join me and make a donation now to help fund this important work? https://t.co/0TEuUE567v

We all need to do our part to fight the spread of coronavirus. Please stay home unless you are visiting a doctor buying groceries or food exercising outdoors or going to work at an essential job. https://t.co/wScFsUt7bl
Illinois — it’s extremely important that we stay at home and help stop the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/C0R2dJO99K

I’m working with @TammyforIL to ensure our student veterans continue to receive their full benefits even as colleges and universities move online to help stop the spread of coronavirus. https://t.co/OvaaY8Y9kx

During a national emergency like the coronavirus pandemic the Senate should have the option to work and vote remotely. I’m joining my colleague @robportman to help make that a reality. https://t.co/Rkgn46MHGo

I’ve been talking to business leaders and discussing the impacts of COVID-19 on our industries but our first priority during this epidemic must be taking care of our workers and families. https://t.co/6PKuTj5rPe

We are all deeply saddened by the first death from COVID-19 in Illinois. We must continue to do everything we can to prevent infecting ourselves and others and spreading this deadly virus. https://t.co/Dbt8vyZ0nA

Our future is on the line in November. But in light of this public health emergency this is no ordinary election season. To help slow the spread of coronavirus and keep my friends and supporters safe I have canceled all public campaign events indefinitely.
The Senate must pass the Families First Coronavirus Response Act immediately.  https://t.co/cTsbaqdn3O

The coronavirus has been declared a pandemic — and the shortage of test kits is unacceptable. I’m doing everything I can to ensure there are enough test kits available for families in Illinois. https://t.co/GXLOoOGuPY

Illinois is home to one of the busiest airports in America. Citizens deserve to know that clear guidance has been issued for proper airport screening to contain the spread of coronavirus. https://t.co/iHxGCseW1q

There is no question that workers need access to paid sick leave during a public health crisis like the coronavirus outbreak. I urge my Republican colleagues to reconsider this shortsighted decision. https://t.co/rLErvOw1Aa

We need comprehensive screenings at airports to ensure travelers from highly-infected areas are not spreading coronavirus in the United States. This is a matter of public health and safety. https://t.co/4kTd4g5HVb

I joined @murraycampaign to introduce important legislation that would immediately ensure all workers have access to at least 14 days of paid sick leave during the coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/ZU4DsVLWmN

The spread of coronavirus poses a serious public health threat for Illinois families. I commend @JBPritzker for taking meaningful action to keep citizens healthy and safe during this outbreak. https://t.co/Mumyy1e9iu

I brought public health officials together to discuss the impacts of coronavirus including ensuring that best practices are being employed at all levels and that testing and treatment is available to all. https://t.co/rD71z8IQ8s

I led a roundtable discussion with public health officials yesterday around questions about the coronavirus including our efforts to ensure that testing is affordable and available to everyone. https://t.co/03tBOygSHR

We must do everything in our power to stop the spread of coronavirus and treat those who have been infected. I’m glad the Senate acted quickly to approve the necessary resources. https://t.co/G2GEgC4vjJ
Coronavirus is a serious public health concern. We need a realistic response and competent leadership at the helm during this crisis. https://t.co/1XULIEPh5I
So far the Trump Administration’s response to coronavirus is insufficient. We need to listen to our health officials and prepare to respond to a serious outbreak in the U.S. https://t.co/5myz9CN7NR

I’m supporting the Public Health Emergency Response and Accountability Act because we need to ensure we are prepared to respond to infectious disease outbreaks like coronavirus. https://t.co/3PHE36MCp2

I commend Chicago’s Department of Public Health for their response to two cases of coronavirus in Illinois. At the federal level we need a dramatic increase in funding to stop the spread of this disease in its tracks. https://t.co/5JIjo68zLd
With two known cases of coronavirus in Illinois I am staying in close contact with the CDC to ensure we’re protecting public health here and across the country. https://t.co/D5kMjiP1FU
With this confirmed case of coronavirus in Chicago I am working closely with the CDC to ensure we are doing everything possible to protect our public health. https://t.co/sxd8eE9nlO
